snippet: A Malaysian official said a missing jetliner may have changed its path at the time communications ended, possibly explaining the westward expansion of the search area.
abstract: Malaysian authorities believe that Malaysian Airlines Flight 370 may have radically changed course around the time it lost contact with ground controllers; news adds to air of confusion and disarray surrounding the investigation and search operation, which has frustrated families of those on board the plane.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher and Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A Malaysian official said a missing jetliner may have changed its path at the time communications ended, possibly explaining the westward expansion of the search area.

headline.main: Confusion Over Plane’s Route Frustrates Families and Search
headline.print_headline: Confusion Over Plane’s Route Frustrates Families and Search
